Title: Corticothalamic connections from the second somatosensory area and neighboring regions in the latreal sulcus of macaque monkeys
Abstract: Corticothalamic connections were shown between the second somatosensory area in primates and the ventroposterior nuclei of the thalamus. These projections were topographically arranged with those from the hindlimb portions of SII traced to the most lateral and posterior parts of the ventroposterior lateral nucleus (VPLc) and those from the forelimb located medially within VPLc. The densest labeling was found ventrally in VPLc and dorsally within ventroposterior inferior n. (VPI) only after injections of the forelimb. A more scattered, dorsal distribution of labeling was seen in the rest of VPLc from injections involving more proximal parts of the body representation in SII.

@Methods.Comments: Only five cases are presented in the injections and results.

@Injections.Citation: "In M22, the injection was placed near the posterior end of the insula, along the superior limiting sulcus, where portions of of the trunk and leg representation in SII are located."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A comparison between the distributions of labeling in M31 vs. M22 also indicate different topograohies in VPLc."

@Injections.Citation: "In two cases, the injections spread from the forelimb representation..to involve substantially the buried part of area 7.."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In M24, the labeling in VPLc was found dorsal, lateral and posteriro to VPI."

@Injections.Citation: "In two cases, the injections spread from the forelimb representation..to involve substantially the buried part of area 7..; part of the face area of SII was also covered by the injection in M25."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In M31, labeling was located furthest lateral in VPLc, whil in M25 and M26, it was most intense in more medial parts of VPLc."

@Injections.Citation: "In one case (M26) only the distal forelimb digit area on the inner face of the parietal operculum was heavily labeled."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In tzhese cases involving the forelimb, a triangular zone of intense labeling extended down to the ventralmost margins of the ventroposterior nuclei to a portion of the thalamus that includes the VPI region."

@Injections.Citation: "In M31 the injection primarily affected cortex lying posterior to the foot and tail representations in SII. In this case, however, the tracers spread rostrally along the fundus of the lateral sulcus to just touch on the hindlimb representation."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "A comparison between the distributions of labeling in M31 vs. M22 also indicate different topograohies in VPLc."

publication.title: Corticothalamic connections from the second somatosensory area and neighboring regions in the latreal sulcus of macaque monkeys
publication.abstract: Corticothalamic connections were shown between the second somatosensory area in primates and the ventroposterior nuclei of the thalamus. These projections were topographically arranged with those from the hindlimb portions of SII traced to the most lateral and posterior parts of the ventroposterior lateral nucleus (VPLc) and those from the forelimb located medially within VPLc. The densest labeling was found ventrally in VPLc and dorsally within ventroposterior inferior n. (VPI) only after injections of the forelimb. A more scattered, dorsal distribution of labeling was seen in the rest of VPLc from injections involving more proximal parts of the body representation in SII.
